abstract.text: A sorted set of media items from the media library.

inlineContent.text: Typically, you use this class by requesting an array of
from a media query by way of its collections property.
The grouping type for the media query determines the arrangement of the media items you obtain. You also use the media query
property to obtain synced playlists, as described in
A media item collection can have a wide range of metadata associated with it. You access this metadata using the
method along with the property keys described in this document. You can also access metadata in a batch fashion using the
method. In some cases, this is more efficient.
defines and describes both of these methods.

abstract.text: Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.
The abstract superclass for media items, media item collections, and media playlist instances.
Executes a provided block with the fetched values for the given item properties.
Retrieves the value for a specified media property key.
A collection of properties that represents a single item in the media library.
A graphical image, such as music album cover art, associated with a media item.
A sorted set of media items from the media library.
Creates a media item collection by copying an array of media items.
The number of media items in a collection.
Initializes a media item collection with an array of media items.
The media items in a media item collection.
The types of the media items in a collection.
A media item whose properties are representative of the other media items in a collection.
A playable collection of related media items.
A set of attributes for describing a playlist when creating it.
A query that specifies a set of media items from the device’s media library using a filter and a grouping type.
An array of media item collections whose contained items match the query’s media property predicate.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
